body: Be A Junior Ranger       Explore. Learn. Protect. The National Park Service's Junior Ranger program began in the 1960s and was adopted to help children and their families explore and learn about their national parks, cultivating future generations of park stewards. Participate in our Junior Ranger program, and learn about the rich and fascinating history of St. Paul's Church National Historic Site. Download your own copy of our Junior Ranger booklet for the site to bring with you when you visit St. Paul's. Finish the activities to be sworn in as a St. Paul's Church Junior Park Ranger!
title: Saint Paul's Church National Historic Site: Be A Junior Ranger
